a.class: u_1218257936 align-center dmButtonLink dmWidget dmWwr default dmOnlyButton dmDefaultGradient

span.span: Updates Regarding School Closure as of 4/1/20:

span.strong: Governor Kemp has announced that all schools in GA will remain closed for in-person instruction for the rest of the school year. This unprecedented closure does bring a lot of questions for our students and families as well as us educators, and we will do our very best to get you the information in a timely manner. Please understand that this is "new" information/news for us as well. You will be receiving more information soon with regards to school decisions around end of year activities, grades, school work, etc. The GA Department of Education will also be providing guidance to Superintendents over the next couple of days that we will pass on to our employees, students and parents.

As far as our distance learning efforts with both packets and online forums, our students and teachers have been doing a fabulous job. We will continue to work with your child through distance learning and will be making decisions soon about how long to continue distance learning as we receive more guidance from State Superintendent Woods and the GA Department of Education. Our students should continue their assignments for this week, and then ENJOY next week as a spring break vacation.
Please either call your child's school number during school hours 8am-3pm or email your child's teacher/principal for specific questions you may have.

div.p: There will be a called Board Meeting on Thursday, April 2nd at 4pm for personnel only. The meeting will be available to view by Live Stream .

br.p: Substitutes: We've partnered with ESS to manage our substitute program. If you're interested in working as a substitute for our district, please visit www.ESS.jobs to apply or call (877) 983-2244 for more information.

div.p: Please click HERE to access the Bid Ad for summer 2020 projects.

p.strong: Please contact your child's new school for information on registration.

div.p: If you have a child who will be 4 years old by September 1st, he/she is eligible to attend the Brantley County Pre-K Program! Registration at each school (Waynesville Primary, Nahunta Primary & Hoboken Elementary) begins March 2nd.

div.div: Heron Hustle 5K/Fun Run for Special Education

div.p: The 2020 Heron Hustle 5K & Fun Run is coming up on March 28th! Come out and support a great cause. All proceeds go toward our Special Education events like Special Olympics. Please click HERE for the flyer and registration form.
